summary: This is a court opinion and order by Judge Alison J. Nathan denying Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed motion for release on bail pending trial. The judge reaffirms the initial detention decision, citing Maxwell as a clear flight risk due to the seriousness of the charges, strong government evidence, her substantial financial resources, foreign ties, and lack of candor about her finances.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned a six-count indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest
events.description: The indictment was unsealed and Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in New Hampshire.

events.title: Initial Bail Hearing
events.description: The court held a lengthy bail hearing and denied bail, concluding Maxwell was a clear flight risk.

events.title: Renewed Bail Motion Denied
events.description: Judge Nathan issued this opinion denying Maxwell's renewed motion for release on bail.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on charges including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts and perjury.

The court found Maxwell a clear flight risk due to serious charges, strong evidence, substantial resources, foreign citizenship (France, which does not extradite its citizens), and lack of candor about finances.
Maxwell's proposed $28.5 million bail package and conditions like home confinement with GPS monitoring were deemed insufficient to assure her appearance.
The court noted Maxwell had demonstrated an 'extraordinary capacity to evade detection' prior to her arrest.
COVID-19 concerns at the Metropolitan Detention Center were acknowledged but deemed not a basis for release given the flight risk determination.
